intro: Eryngium weberbaueri, commonly known as the desert thistle, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its spiny, blue-green foliage and purple to violet flower heads that resemble thistles. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky soils. Its flowering period occurs in the summer months, and it is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Eryngium weberbaueri is often found in open habitats and is a member of the Asteraceae family.
